BM.GSR.TOTL.CD.name: Imports of goods, services and primary income (BoP, current US$)
BM.GSR.TOTL.CD.value: Imports of goods, services and primary income is the sum of goods imports, service imports and primary income payments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BN.CAB.XOKA.CD.name: Current account balance (BoP, current US$)
BN.CAB.XOKA.CD.value: Current account balance is the sum of net exports of goods and services, net primary income, and net secondary income. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.GRT.EXTA.CD.DT.name: Grants, excluding technical cooperation (current US$)
BX.GRT.EXTA.CD.DT.value: Grants are defined as legally binding commitments that obligate a specific value of funds available for disbursement for which there is no repayment requirement. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.GRT.TECH.CD.DT.name: Technical cooperation grants (current US$)
BX.GRT.TECH.CD.DT.value: Technical cooperation grants include free-standing technical cooperation grants, which are intended to finance the transfer of technical and managerial skills or of technology for the purpose of building up general national capacity without reference to any specific investment projects; and investment-related technical cooperation grants, which are provided to strengthen the capacity to execute specific investment projects. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.GSR.TOTL.CD.name: Exports of goods, services and primary income (BoP, current US$)
BX.GSR.TOTL.CD.value: Exports of goods, services and primary income is the sum of goods exports, service exports and primary income receipts. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.KLT.DINV.CD.DT.name: Foreign direct investment, net inflows in reporting economy (DRS, current US$)
BX.KLT.DINV.CD.DT.value: Foreign direct investment (net) shows the net change in foreign investment in the reporting country. Foreign direct investment is defined as investment that is made to acquire a lasting management interest (usually of 10 percent of voting stock) in an enterprise operating in a country other than that of the investor (defined according to residency), the investor's purpose being an effective voice in the management of the enterprise. It is the sum of equity capital, reinvestment of earnings, other long-term capital, and short-term capital as shown in the balance of payments. This series shows net inflows in the reporting economy. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.KLT.DREM.CD.DT.name: Primary income on FDI (current US$)
BX.KLT.DREM.CD.DT.value: Primary income on foreign direct investment covers payments of direct investment income (debit side), which consist of income on equity (dividends, branch profits, and reinvested earnings) and income on the intercompany debt (interest). Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.PEF.TOTL.CD.DT.name: Portfolio investment, equity (DRS, current US$)
BX.PEF.TOTL.CD.DT.value: Portfolio equity includes net inflows from equity securities other than those recorded as direct investment and including shares, stocks, depository receipts (American or global), and direct purchases of shares in local stock markets by foreign investors. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

BX.TRF.PWKR.CD.DT.name: Personal remittances, received (current US$)
BX.TRF.PWKR.CD.DT.value: Personal remittances comprise personal transfers and compensation of employees. Personal transfers consist of all current transfers in cash or in kind made or received by resident households to or from nonresident households. Personal transfers thus include all current transfers between resident and nonresident individuals. Compensation of employees refers to the income of border, seasonal, and other short-term workers who are employed in an economy where they are not resident and of residents employed by nonresident entities. Data are the sum of two items defined in the sixth edition of the IMF's Balance of Payments Manual: personal transfers and compensation of employees. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLAT.CD.name: PPG, bilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLAT.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLAT.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLAT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLAT.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLAT.PS.CD.value: Public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLTC.CD.name: PPG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLTC.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLTC.GG.CD.value: General goverment bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLTC.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLTC.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLTC.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLTC.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector  bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.BLTC.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.BLTC.PS.CD.value: Public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DEGG.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, general government sector (PPG) (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DEGG.CD.value: General government long-term debt are aggregated. General government debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DEPS.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, public sector (PPG) (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DEPS.CD.value: Public sector long-term debt are aggregated. Public sector debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DIMF.CD.name: IMF repurchases (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DIMF.CD.value: IMF repurchases are total repayments of outstanding drawings from the General Resources Account during the year specified, excluding repayments due in the reserve tranche. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DLTF.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, long-term + IMF (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DLTF.CD.value: Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. This item includes principal repayments on long-term debt and IMF repurchases. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. IMF repurchases are total repayments of outstanding drawings from the General Resources Account during the year specified, excluding repayments due in the reserve tranche. To maintain comparability between data on transactions with the IMF and data on long-term debt, use of IMF credit outstanding at the end of year (stock) is converted to dollars at the SDR exchange rate in effect at the end of year. Repurchases (flows) are converted at the average SDR exchange rate for the year in which transactions take place. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DLXF.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, long-term (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DLXF.CD.value: Principal repayments on long-term debt are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DOPS.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, other public sector (PPG) (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DOPS.CD.value: Other public sector long-term debt are aggregated. Other public sector debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DPNG.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DPNG.CD.value: Private nonguaranteed external debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.DPPG.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.DPPG.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.MIBR.CD.name: PPG, IBRD (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.MIBR.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.MIDA.CD.name: PPG, IDA (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.MIDA.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.MLAT.CD.name: PPG, multilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.MLAT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.MLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.MLAT.GG.CD.value: General government multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.MLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, multilateral (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.MLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.MLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, multilateral (AMT, current US$)

Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.OFFT.CD.name: PPG, official creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.OFFT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. DT.AMT.OFFT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. DT.AMT.PBND.CD.name: PPG, bonds (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PBND.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PBND.GG.CD.name: GG, bonds (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PBND.GG.CD.value: General government debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PBND.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bonds (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PBND.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PBND.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bonds (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PBND.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PBND.PS.CD.name: PS, bonds (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PBND.PS.CD.value: Public sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PCBK.CD.name: PPG, commercial banks (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PCBK.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PCBK.GG.CD.name: GG, commercial banks (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PCBK.GG.CD.value: General government commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PCBK.OPS.CD.name: OPS, commercial banks (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PCBK.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector  commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PCBK.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, commercial banks (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PCBK.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PCBK.PS.CD.name: PS, commercial banks (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PCBK.PS.CD.value: Public sector commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PNGB.CD.name: PNG, bonds (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PNGB.CD.value: Nonguaranteed long-term debt from bonds that are privately placed. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PNGC.CD.name: PNG, commercial banks and other creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PNGC.CD.value: Nonguaranteed long-term commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PROP.CD.name: PPG, other private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PROP.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PROP.GG.CD.name: GG, other private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PROP.GG.CD.value: General government other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PROP.OPS.CD.name: OPS, other private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PROP.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PROP.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, other private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PROP.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PROP.PS.CD.name: PS, other private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PROP.PS.CD.value: Public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PRPG.CD.name: Principal repayments on external debt, private guaranteed by public sector (PPG) (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PRPG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector  long-term debt are aggregated.Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PRVT.CD.name: PPG, private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PRVT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PRVT.GG.CD.name: GG, private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PRVT.GG.CD.value: General government debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PRVT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PRVT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PRVT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PRVT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AMT.PRVT.PS.CD.name: PS, private creditors (AMT, current US$)
DT.AMT.PRVT.PS.CD.value: Public sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXA.DPPG.CD.name: Principal arrears, long-term DOD (US$)
DT.AXA.DPPG.CD.value: Principal in arrears on long-term debt is defined as principal repayment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXA.OFFT.CD.name: Principal arrears, official creditors (current US$)
DT.AXA.OFFT.CD.value: Principal in arrears on long-term debt is defined as principal repayment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXA.PRVT.CD.name: Principal arrears, private creditors (current US$)
DT.AXA.PRVT.CD.value: Principal in arrears on long-term debt is defined as principal repayment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXF.DPPG.CD.name: Principal forgiven (current US$)
DT.AXF.DPPG.CD.value: Principal forgiven is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was written off or forgiven in any given year. It includes debt forgiven within and outside Paris Club agreements, principal forgiven and principal arrears forgiven. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXR.DPPG.CD.name: Principal rescheduled (current US$)
DT.AXR.DPPG.CD.value: Principal rescheduled is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXR.OFFT.CD.name: Principal rescheduled, official (current US$)
DT.AXR.OFFT.CD.value: Principal rescheduled is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.AXR.PRVT.CD.name: Principal rescheduled, private (current US$)
DT.AXR.PRVT.CD.value: Principal rescheduled is the amount of principal due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.BLAT.CD.name: Commitments, bilateral creditors (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.BLAT.CD.value: Bilateral commitments are the total amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.DPPG.CD.name: Commitments, public and publicly guaranteed (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.DPPG.CD.value: Commitments are the total amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.MIBR.CD.name: Commitments, IBRD (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.MIBR.CD.value: Commitments (IBRD) are the sum of new commitments on public and publicly guaranteed loans from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD). Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.MIDA.CD.name: Commitments, IDA (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.MIDA.CD.value: Commitments (IDA) are the sum of new commitments on public and publicly guaranteed loans from the International Development Association (IDA). Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.MLAT.CD.name: Commitments, multilateral creditors (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.MLAT.CD.value: Multirateral commitments are the total amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.OFFT.CD.name: Commitments, official creditors (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.OFFT.CD.value: Commitments are the amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.COM.PRVT.CD.name: Commitments, private creditors (COM, current US$)
DT.COM.PRVT.CD.value: Commitments are the amount of long-term loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.CUR.DMAK.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, Deutsche mark (%)
DT.CUR.DMAK.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Deutsche marks for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.EURO.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, Euro (%)
DT.CUR.EURO.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Euros for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.FFRC.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, French franc (%)
DT.CUR.FFRC.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in French francs for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.JYEN.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, Japanese yen (%)
DT.CUR.JYEN.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Japanese yen for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.MULC.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, Multiple currencies (%)
DT.CUR.MULC.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in multiple currencies for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.OTHC.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, all other currencies (%)
DT.CUR.OTHC.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in all other currencies not specified for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.SDRW.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, SDR (%)
DT.CUR.SDRW.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in special drawing rights for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.SWFR.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, Swiss franc (%)
DT.CUR.SWFR.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in Swiss francs for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.UKPS.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, Pound sterling (%)
DT.CUR.UKPS.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in U.K. pound sterling for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.CUR.USDL.ZS.name: Currency composition of PPG debt, U.S. dollars (%)
DT.CUR.USDL.ZS.value: The percentage of external long-term public and publicly-guaranteed debt contracted in U.S. dollars for the low- and middle-income countries.

DT.DFR.DPPG.CD.name: Debt forgiveness or reduction (current US$)
DT.DFR.DPPG.CD.value: Debt forgiveness or reduction shows the change in debt stock due to debt forgiveness or reduction. It is derived by subtracting debt forgiven and debt stock reduction from debt buyback. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLAT.CD.name: PPG, bilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLAT.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLAT.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLAT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector  bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLAT.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLAT.PS.CD.value: Public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLTC.CD.name: PPG, bilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLTC.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLTC.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLTC.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLTC.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLTC.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLTC.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector  bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.BLTC.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.BLTC.PS.CD.value: Public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DEGG.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, general government sector (PPG) (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DEGG.CD.value: General government long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DEPS.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, public sector (PPG) (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DEPS.CD.value: Public sector long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DIMF.CD.name: IMF purchases (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DIMF.CD.value: IMF purchases are total drawings on the General Resources Account of the IMF during the year specified, excluding drawings in the reserve tranche. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DLTF.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, long-term + IMF (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DLTF.CD.value: Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. This item includes disbursements on long-term debt and IMF purchases. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. IMF purchases are total drawings on the General Resources Account of the IMF during the year specified, excluding drawings in the reserve tranche. To maintain comparability between data on transactions with the IMF and data on long-term debt, use of IMF credit outstanding at the end of year (stock) is converted to dollars at the SDR exchange rate in effect at the end of year. Purchases are converted at the average SDR exchange rate for the year in which transactions take place. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DLXF.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, long-term (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DLXF.CD.value: Disbursements on long-term debt are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DOPS.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, other public sector (PPG) (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DOPS.CD.value: Other public sector long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DPNG.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DPNG.CD.value: Private nonguaranteed external debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.DPPG.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.DPPG.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.IDAG.CD.name: IDA grants (current US$)
DT.DIS.IDAG.CD.value: IDA grants are net disbursements of grants from the International Development Association (IDA). Data are in current U.S. dollars. Regional allocations are included in aggregate data.

DT.DIS.MIBR.CD.name: PPG, IBRD (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.MIBR.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MIDA.CD.name: PPG, IDA (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.MIDA.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MLAT.CD.name: PPG, multilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.MLAT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.MLAT.GG.CD.value: General government multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MLAT.PS.CD.name: PS, multilateral (DIS, current US$)

Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MLTC.CD.name: PPG, multilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.MLTC.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.MLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral concessional (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.MLTC.GG.CD.value: General goverment multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. DT.DIS.OFFT.CD.name: PPG, official creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.OFFT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.OFFT.GG.CD.name: GG, official creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.OFFT.GG.CD.value: General government debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.OFFT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, official creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.OFFT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.OFFT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, official creditors (DIS, current US$)

Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PBND.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PBND.GG.CD.name: GG, bonds (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PBND.GG.CD.value: General government debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PBND.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bonds (DIS, current US$)

DT.DIS.PBND.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bonds (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PBND.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PBND.PS.CD.name: PS, bonds (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PBND.PS.CD.value: Public sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PCBK.CD.name: PPG, commercial banks (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PCBK.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PCBK.GG.CD.name: GG, commercial banks (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PCBK.GG.CD.value: General government commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PCBK.OPS.CD.name: OPS, commercial banks (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PCBK.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PCBK.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, commercial banks (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PCBK.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PNGB.CD.value: Nonguaranteed long-term debt from bonds that are privately placed. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PNGC.CD.value: Nonguaranteed long-term commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PROP.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PROP.GG.CD.name: GG, other private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PROP.GG.CD.value: General government other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PROP.OPS.CD.name: OPS, other private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PROP.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PROP.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, other private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PROP.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PROP.PS.CD.name: PS, other private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PROP.PS.CD.value: Public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. DT.DIS.PRPG.CD.name: Disbursements on external debt, private guaranteed by public sector (PPG) (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PRPG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PRVT.CD.name: PPG, private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PRVT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PRVT.GG.CD.name: GG, private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PRVT.GG.CD.value: General government other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PRVT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, private creditors (DIS, current US$)
