Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PRVT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PRVT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DIS.PRVT.PS.CD.name: PS, private creditors (DIS, current US$)
DT.DIS.PRVT.PS.CD.value: Public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Disbursements are drawings by the borrower on loan commitments during the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.ALLC.CD.name: External debt stocks, concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.ALLC.CD.value: Concessional external debt conveys information about the borrower's receipt of aid from official lenders at concessional terms as defined by the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) of the OECD. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Loans from major regional development banks--African Development Bank, Asian Development Bank, and the Inter-American Development Bank--and from the World Bank are classified as concessional according to each institution's classification and not according to the DAC definition, as was the practice in earlier reports. Long-term debt outstanding and disbursed is the total outstanding long-term debt at year end. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.ALLC.ZS.name: Concessional debt (% of total external debt)
DT.DOD.ALLC.ZS.value: Concessional debt to total external debt stocks. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more.

DT.DOD.BLAT.CD.name: PPG, bilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLAT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLAT.GG.CD.value: General Government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other Public Sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLAT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLAT.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLAT.PS.CD.value: Public sector  bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLTC.CD.name: PPG, bilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLTC.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLTC.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLTC.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLTC.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLTC.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLTC.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector  bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.BLTC.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.BLTC.PS.CD.value: Public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DECT.CD.name: External debt stocks, total (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DECT.CD.value: Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt. Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DECT.CD.CG.name: Total change in external debt stocks (current US$)
DT.DOD.DECT.CD.CG.value: Total change in debt stocks shows the variation in debt stock between two consecutive years. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DECT.EX.ZS.name: External debt stocks (% of exports of goods, services and primary income)
DT.DOD.DECT.EX.ZS.value: Total external debt stocks to exports of goods, services and primary income.

DT.DOD.DECT.GN.ZS.name: External debt stocks (% of GNI)
DT.DOD.DECT.GN.ZS.value: Total external debt stocks to gross national income. Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt. Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. GNI (formerly GNP) is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad.

DT.DOD.DEGG.CD.name: External debt stocks, general government sector (PPG) (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DEGG.CD.value: General Government Sector comprises long-term external obligations of public debtors, including the national government of all levels, and political subdivisions (or an agency of either).   Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DEPS.CD.name: External debt stocks, public sector (PPG) (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DEPS.CD.value: Public sector debt comprises long-term external obligations of public debtors, including the national government of all levels, political subdivisions (or an agency of either), autonomous public bodies such as Public Corporations, State Owned Enterprises, Development Banks and Other Mixed Enterprises. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DIMF.CD.name: Use of IMF credit (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DIMF.CD.value: Use of IMF Credit: Data related to the operations of the IMF are provided by the IMF Treasurer‚Äôs Department. They are converted from special drawing rights into dollars using end-of-period exchange rates for stocks and average-over-the-period exchange rates for flows. IMF trust fund operations under the Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility, Extended Fund Facility, Poverty Reduction and Growth Facility, and Structural Adjustment Facility (Enhanced Structural Adjustment Facility in 1999) are presented together with all of the IMF‚Äôs special facilities (buffer stock, supplemental reserve, compensatory and contingency facilities, oil facilities, and other facilities). SDR allocations are also included in this category. According to the BPM6, SDR allocations are recorded as the incurrence of a debt liability of the member receiving them (because of a requirement to repay the allocation in certain circumstances, and also because interest accrues). This debt item is introduced for the first time this year with historical data starting in 1999.

DT.DOD.DLXF.CD.name: External debt stocks, long-term (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DLXF.CD.value: Long-term debt is debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year. It has three components: public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DOPS.CD.name: External debt stocks, other public sector (PPG) (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DOPS.CD.value: Other Public Sector debt comprises long-term external obligations of public debtors, excluding general government. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DPNG.CD.name: External debt stocks, private nonguaranteed (PNG) (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DPNG.CD.value: Private nonguaranteed external debt comprises long-term external obligations of private debtors that are not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DPPG.CD.name: External debt stocks, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DPPG.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt comprises long-term external obligations of public debtors, including the national government,  Public Corporations, State Owned Enterprises, Development Banks and Other Mixed Enterprises, political subdivisions (or an agency of either), autonomous public bodies, and external obligations of private debtors that are guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DSDR.CD.name: Use of IMF credit, SDR allocations (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DSDR.CD.value: SDR allocations are also included in this category. According to the BPM6, SDR allocations are recorded as the incurrence of a debt liability of the member receiving them (because of a requirement to repay the allocation in certain circumstances, and also because interest accrues). This debt item is introduced for the first time this year with historical data starting in 1999.

DT.DOD.DSTC.CD.name: External debt stocks, short-term (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.DSTC.CD.value: Short-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original maturity of one year or less. Available data permit no distinction between public and private nonguaranteed short-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.DSTC.ZS.name: Short-term debt (% of total external debt)
DT.DOD.DSTC.ZS.value: Short-term debt includes all debt having an original maturity of one year or less and interest in arrears on long-term debt. Total external debt is debt owed to nonresidents repayable in currency, goods, or services. Total external debt is the sum of public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term debt, use of IMF credit, and short-term debt.

DT.DOD.MDRI.CD.name: Debt forgiveness grants (current US$)
DT.DOD.MDRI.CD.value: Debt forgiveness grants data cover both debt cancelled by agreement between debtor and creditor and a reduction in the net present value of non-ODA debt achieved by concessional rescheduling or refinancing. The  data are on a disbursement basis and cover flows from all bilateral and multilateral donors. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MIBR.CD.name: PPG, IBRD (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MIBR.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is nonconcessional. Nonconcessional debt excludes loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MIDA.CD.name: PPG, IDA (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MIDA.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt outstanding from the International Development Association (IDA) is concessional. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLAT.CD.name: PPG, multilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLAT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLAT.GG.CD.value: General government multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, multilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, multilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLAT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLAT.PS.CD.name: PS, multilateral (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLAT.PS.CD.value: Public sector multilateral creditors are international financial institutions such as the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies whose lending is administered on a multilateral basis. Funds administered by an international financial organization on behalf of a single donor government constitute bilateral loans (or grants). For lending by a number of multilateral creditors, the data presented in this publication are taken from the creditors‚Äô records. Such creditors include the African Development Bank, the Asian Development Bank, the IDB, IBRD, and IDA. (IBRD and IDA are institutions of the World Bank.) Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLAT.ZS.name: Multilateral debt (% of total external debt)
DT.DOD.MLAT.ZS.value: Multilateral debt to total external debt stocks.

DT.DOD.MLTC.CD.name: PPG, multilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLTC.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLTC.GG.CD.value: General government  multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLTC.OPS.CD.name: OPS, multilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLTC.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLTC.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, multilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLTC.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.MLTC.PS.CD.name: PS, multilateral concessional (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.MLTC.PS.CD.value: Public sector guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.OFFT.CD.name: PPG, official creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.OFFT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.OFFT.GG.CD.name: GG, official creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.OFFT.GG.CD.value: General government debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.OFFT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, official creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.OFFT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector  debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.OFFT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, official creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.OFFT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.OFFT.PS.CD.name: PS, official creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.OFFT.PS.CD.value: Public sector debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PBND.CD.name: PPG, bonds (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PBND.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PBND.GG.CD.name: GG, bonds (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PBND.GG.CD.value: General government  debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PBND.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bonds (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PBND.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector  debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PBND.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bonds (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PBND.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PBND.PS.CD.name: PS, bonds (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PBND.PS.CD.value: Public sector debt from bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PCBK.CD.name: PPG, commercial banks (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PCBK.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PCBK.GG.CD.name: GG, commercial banks (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PCBK.GG.CD.value: General government  commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PCBK.OPS.CD.name: OPS, commercial banks (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PCBK.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PCBK.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, commercial banks (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PCBK.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PCBK.PS.CD.name: PS, commercial banks (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PCBK.PS.CD.value: Commercial bank loans are loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PNGB.CD.name: PNG, bonds (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PNGB.CD.value: Nonguaranteed long-term debt from bonds that are privately placed. Private nonguaranteed long-term debt outstanding and disbursed is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PNGC.CD.name: PNG, commercial banks and other creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PNGC.CD.value: Nonguaranteed long-term commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions. Private nonguaranteed long-term debt outstanding and disbursed is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PROP.CD.name: PPG, other private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PROP.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PROP.GG.CD.name: GG, other private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PROP.GG.CD.value: General government other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PROP.OPS.CD.name: OPS, other private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PROP.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector  other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PROP.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, other private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PROP.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PROP.PS.CD.name: PS, other private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PROP.PS.CD.value: Public sector other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRPG.CD.name: External debt stocks, private guaranteed by public sector (PPG) (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRPG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt comprises external obligations of private debtors that are guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRVS.CD.name: External debt stocks, long-term private sector (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRVS.CD.value: Long-term private sector external debt conveys information about the distribution of long-term debt for DRS countries by type of debtor (private banks and private entities). Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRVT.CD.name: PPG, private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRVT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRVT.GG.CD.name: GG, private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRVT.GG.CD.value: General government debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRVT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRVT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector  debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRVT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRVT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by public sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PRVT.PS.CD.name: PS, private creditors (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PRVT.PS.CD.value: Private creditors include commercial banks, bondholders, and other private creditors. This line includes only publicly guaranteed creditors. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PUBS.CD.name: External debt stocks, long-term public sector (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.PUBS.CD.value: Long-term public sector external debt conveys information about the distribution of long-term debt for DRS countries by type of debtor (central government, state and local government, central bank, public and mixed enterprises, and official development banks). Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.PVLX.CD.name: Present value of external debt (current US$)
DT.DOD.PVLX.CD.value: Present value of debt is the sum of short-term external debt plus the discounted sum of total debt service payments due on public, publicly guaranteed, and private nonguaranteed long-term external debt over the life of existing loans. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.RSDL.CD.name: Residual, debt stock-flow reconciliation (current US$)
DT.DOD.RSDL.CD.value: The residual difference, i.e. the change in stock not explained by any of the factors identified under debt stock-flow reconciliation, is calculated as the sum of identified accounts minus the change in stock. Where the latter is large it can, in some cases, serve as an illustration of the inconsistencies in the reported data. More often however, it can be explained by specific borrowing phenomenon in individual countries. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DOD.VTOT.CD.name: External debt stocks, variable rate (DOD, current US$)
DT.DOD.VTOT.CD.value: Variable interest rate is long-term external debt with interest rates that float with movements in a key market rate; for example, the London interbank offered rate (LIBOR) or the U.S. prime rate. This item conveys information about the borrower's exposure to changes in international interest rates. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DSB.DPPG.CD.name: Debt buyback (current US$)
DT.DSB.DPPG.CD.value: Debt buyback is the repurchase by a debtor of its own debt, discounted or at par. In the event of a buyback of long-term debt, the face value of the debt bought back will be recorded as a decline in the long-term debt stock, and the cash amount received by creditors will be recorded as a principal repayment. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DSF.DPPG.CD.name: Debt stock reduction (current US$)
DT.DSF.DPPG.CD.value: Debt stock reductions show the amount that has been netted out of the stock of debt using debt conversion schemes such as buybacks and equity swaps or the discounted value of long-term bonds that were issued in exchange for outstanding debt. It includes the effect of any financial operation that will reduce the debt stock other than debt stock restructuring, repayment of principal and debt forgiven. In particular, debt stock reduction will include the face value of debt bought back, the face value of debt swapped for equity (or "nature" or "development"), any face value reduction that might result as the consequence of a bond exchange, and any face value reduction resulting from an exchange of debt for discount bonds. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.DXR.DPPG.CD.name: Debt stock rescheduled (current US$)
DT.DXR.DPPG.CD.value: Debt stocks rescheduled is the amount of debt outstanding rescheduled in any given year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.GPA.DPPG.name: Average grace period on new external debt commitments (years)
DT.GPA.DPPG.value: Grace period is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the grace periods for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity.

DT.GPA.OFFT.name: Average grace period on new external debt commitments, official (years)
DT.GPA.OFFT.value: Grace period is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the grace periods for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

DT.GPA.PRVT.name: Average grace period on new external debt commitments, private (years)
DT.GPA.PRVT.value: Grace period is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the grace periods for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

DT.GRE.DPPG.name: Average grant element on new external debt commitments (%)
DT.GRE.DPPG.value: The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. To obtain the average, the grant elements for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Commitments cover the total amount of loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available.

DT.GRE.OFFT.name: Average grant element on new external debt commitments, official (%)
DT.GRE.OFFT.value: The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. To obtain the average, the grant elements for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Commitments cover the total amount of loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

DT.GRE.PRVT.name: Average grant element on new external debt commitments, private (%)
DT.GRE.PRVT.value: The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. To obtain the average, the grant elements for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Commitments cover the total amount of loans for which contracts were signed in the year specified. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

DT.INR.DPPG.name: Average interest on new external debt commitments (%)
DT.INR.DPPG.value: Interest represents the average interest rate on all new public and publicly guaranteed loans contracted during the year. To obtain the average, the interest rates for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity.

DT.INR.OFFT.name: Average interest on new external debt commitments, official (%)
DT.INR.OFFT.value: Interest represents the average interest rate on all new public and publicly guaranteed loans contracted during the year. To obtain the average, the interest rates for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

DT.INR.PRVT.name: Average interest on new external debt commitments, private (%)
DT.INR.PRVT.value: Interest represents the average interest rate on all new public and publicly guaranteed loans contracted during the year. To obtain the average, the interest rates for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

DT.INT.BLAT.CD.name: PPG, bilateral (INT, current US$)
DT.INT.BLAT.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.INT.BLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral (INT, current US$)
DT.INT.BLAT.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.INT.BLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral (INT, current US$)
DT.INT.BLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.INT.BLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral (INT, current US$)

It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. DT.INT.PRVT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, private creditors (INT, current US$)
DT.INT.PRVT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.INT.PRVT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, private creditors (INT, current US$)
DT.INT.PRVT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.INT.PRVT.PS.CD.name: PS, private creditors (INT, current US$)
DT.INT.PRVT.PS.CD.value: Public sector debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Interest payments are actual amounts of interest paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXA.DPPG.CD.name: Interest arrears, long-term DOD (US$)
DT.IXA.DPPG.CD.value: Interest in arrears on long-term debt is defined as interest payment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXA.DPPG.CD.CG.name: Net change in interest arrears (current US$)
DT.IXA.DPPG.CD.CG.value: Net change in interest arrears is the variation in the total amount of interest in arrears between two consecutive years. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXA.OFFT.CD.name: Interest arrears, official creditors (current US$)
DT.IXA.OFFT.CD.value: Interest in arrears on long-term debt is defined as interest payment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXA.PRVT.CD.name: Interest arrears, private creditors (current US$)
DT.IXA.PRVT.CD.value: Interest in arrears on long-term debt is defined as interest payment due but not paid, on a cumulative basis. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXF.DPPG.CD.name: Interest forgiven (current US$)
DT.IXF.DPPG.CD.value: Interest forgiven is the amount of interest due or in arrears that was written off or forgiven in any given year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXR.DPPG.CD.name: Interest rescheduled (capitalized) (current US$)
DT.IXR.DPPG.CD.value: Interest rescheduled is the amount of interest due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. (Interest capitalized is the interest that became part of the stock of debt due to a rescheduling operation.) Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXR.OFFT.CD.name: Interest rescheduled, official (current US$)
DT.IXR.OFFT.CD.value: Interest rescheduled is the amount of interest due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organizations include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.IXR.PRVT.CD.name: Interest rescheduled, private (current US$)
DT.IXR.PRVT.CD.value: Interest rescheduled is the amount of interest due or in arrears that was rescheduled in any given year. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.MAT.DPPG.name: Average maturity on new external debt commitments (years)
DT.MAT.DPPG.value: Maturity is the number of years to original maturity date, which is the sum of grace and repayment periods. Grace period for principal is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. The repayment period is the period from the first to last repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the maturity for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity.

DT.MAT.OFFT.name: Average maturity on new external debt commitments, official (years)
DT.MAT.OFFT.value: Maturity is the number of years to original maturity date, which is the sum of grace and repayment periods. Grace period for principal is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. The repayment period is the period from the first to last repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the maturity for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.

DT.MAT.PRVT.name: Average maturity on new external debt commitments, private (years)
DT.MAT.PRVT.value: Maturity is the number of years to original maturity date, which is the sum of grace and repayment periods. Grace period for principal is the period from the date of signature of the loan or the issue of the financial instrument to the first repayment of principal. The repayment period is the period from the first to last repayment of principal. To obtain the average, the maturity for all public and publicly guaranteed loans have been weighted by the amounts of the loans. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency.

DT.NFL.BLAT.CD.name: Net financial flows, bilateral (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLAT.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLAT.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.  Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLAT.OPS.CD.value: Other public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.  Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLAT.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.  Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLAT.PS.CD.name: PS, bilateral (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLAT.PS.CD.value: Public sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies.  Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLTC.CD.name: PPG, bilateral concessional (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLTC.CD.value: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, bilateral concessional (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLTC.GG.CD.value: General government bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLTC.OPS.CD.name: OPS, bilateral concessional (NFL, current US$)

Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.BLTC.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, bilateral concessional (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.BLTC.PRVG.CD.value: Private sector guaranteed by Public Sector bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DECT.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, total (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DECT.CD.value: Net flows on external debt are disbursements on long-term external debt and IMF purchases minus principal repayments on long-term external debt and IMF repurchases up to 1984. Beginning in 1985 this line includes the change in stock of short-term debt (including interest arrears for long-term debt). Thus, if the change in stock is positive, a disbursement is assumed to have taken place; if negative, a repayment is assumed to have taken place. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DEGG.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, general government sector (PPG) (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DEGG.CD.value: General government long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DEPS.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, public sector (PPG) (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DEPS.CD.value: Public sector long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DLXF.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, long-term (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DLXF.CD.value: Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DOPS.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, other public sector (PPG) (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DOPS.CD.value: Other public sector long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DPNG.CD.value: Private nonguaranteed external debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is not guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DPPG.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, public and publicly guaranteed (PPG) (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DPPG.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Long-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original or extended maturity of more than one year and that is owed to nonresidents by residents of an economy and repayable in currency, goods, or services. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.DSTC.CD.name: Net flows on external debt, short-term (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.DSTC.CD.value: Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Short-term external debt is defined as debt that has an original maturity of one year or less. Available data permit no distinction between public and private nonguaranteed short-term debt. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.IMFC.CD.name: Net financial flows, IMF concessional (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.IMFC.CD.value: Net financial flows received by the borrower during the year are disbursements of loans and credits less repayments of principal. IMF is the International Monetary Fund, which provides concessional lending through the Poverty Reduction and Growth Facility and the IMF Trust Fund. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.IMFN.CD.name: Net financial flows, IMF nonconcessional (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.IMFN.CD.value: Net financial flows received by the borrower during the year are disbursements of loans and credits less repayments of principal. IMF is the International Monetary Fund, which provides nonconcessional lending through the credit it provides to its members, mainly to meet balance of payments needs. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.MIBR.CD.name: Net financial flows, IBRD (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.MIBR.CD.value: Net financial flows received by the borrower during the year are disbursements of loans and credits less repayments of principal. IBRD is the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the founding and largest member of the World Bank Group. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.MIDA.CD.name: Net financial flows, IDA (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.MIDA.CD.value: Net financial flows received by the borrower during the year are disbursements of loans and credits less repayments of principal. IDA is the International Development Association, the concessional loan window of the World Bank Group. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.MLAT.CD.name: Net financial flows, multilateral (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.MLAT.CD.value: Public and publicly guaranteed multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Net flows (or net lending or net disbursements) received by the borrower during the year are disbursements minus principal repayments. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.MLAT.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral (NFL, current US$)

Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments.  Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.MLAT.OPS.CD.name: OPS, multilateral (NFL, current US$)

Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments.  Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.NFL.MLAT.PRVG.CD.name: PRVG, multilateral (NFL, current US$)

DT.NFL.NEBR.CD.name: EBRD, private nonguaranteed (NFL, current US$)

DT.NFL.NIFC.CD.name: IFC, private nonguaranteed (NFL, current US$)

DT.NFL.OFFT.CD.name: PPG, official creditors (NFL, current US$)

DT.NFL.OFFT.GG.CD.name: GG, official creditors (NFL, current US$)
DT.NFL.OFFT.GG.CD.value: General government debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Net transfers are net flows minus interest payments during the year; negative transfers show net transfers made by the borrower to the creditor during the year. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. DT.TDS.MLTC.GG.CD.name: GG, multilateral concessional (TDS, current US$)
DT.TDS.MLTC.GG.CD.value: General government multilateral loans include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of the amount committed. It is used as a measure of the overall cost of borrowing. The grant equivalent of a loan is its commitment (present) value, less the discounted present value of its contractual debt service; conventionally, future service payments are discounted at 10 percent. Debt service payments are the sum of principal repayments and interest payments actually made in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.TDS.PRVT.GG.CD.name: GG, private creditors (TDS, current US$)

DT.TXR.DPPG.CD.name: Total amount of debt rescheduled (current US$)
DT.TXR.DPPG.CD.value: Total amount of debt rescheduled includes the debt stock, principal, interest, charges and penalties rescheduled. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.UND.DPPG.CD.name: Undisbursed external debt, total (UND, current US$)
DT.UND.DPPG.CD.value: Undisbursed debt is the total public and publicly guaranteed debt undrawn at year end; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Public and publicly guaranteed long-term debt are aggregated. Public debt is an external obligation of a public debtor, including the national government, a political subdivision (or an agency of either), and autonomous public bodies. Publicly guaranteed debt is an external obligation of a private debtor that is guaranteed for repayment by a public entity. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.UND.OFFT.CD.name: Undisbursed external debt, official creditors (UND, current US$)
DT.UND.OFFT.CD.value: Undisbursed debt is the total public and publicly guaranteed debt undrawn at year end; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Debt from official creditors includes loans from international organizations (multilateral loans) and loans from governments (bilateral loans). Loans from international organization include loans and credits from the World Bank, regional development banks, and other multilateral and intergovernmental agencies. Excluded are loans from funds administered by an international organization on behalf of a single donor government; these are classified as loans from governments. Government loans include loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

DT.UND.PRVT.CD.name: Undisbursed external debt, private creditors (UND, current US$)
DT.UND.PRVT.CD.value: Undisbursed debt is the total public and publicly guaranteed debt undrawn at year end; data for private nonguaranteed debt are not available. Debt from private creditors include bonds that are either publicly issued or privately placed; commercial bank loans from private banks and other private financial institutions; and other private credits from manufacturers, exporters, and other suppliers of goods, and bank credits covered by a guarantee of an export credit agency. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

FI.RES.TOTL.CD.name: Total reserves (includes gold, current US$)
FI.RES.TOTL.CD.value: Total reserves comprise holdings of monetary gold, special drawing rights, reserves of IMF members held by the IMF, and holdings of foreign exchange under the control of monetary authorities. The gold component of these reserves is valued at year-end (December 31) London prices. Data are in current U.S. dollars.

FI.RES.TOTL.DT.ZS.name: Total reserves (% of total external debt)
FI.RES.TOTL.DT.ZS.value: International reserves to total external debt stocks.

FI.RES.TOTL.MO.name: Total reserves in months of imports
FI.RES.TOTL.MO.value: Total reserves comprise holdings of monetary gold, special drawing rights, reserves of IMF members held by the IMF, and holdings of foreign exchange under the control of monetary authorities. The gold component of these reserves is valued at year-end (December 31) London prices. This item shows reserves expressed in terms of the number of months of imports of goods and services they could pay for [Reserves/(Imports/12)].

NY.GNP.MKTP.CD.name: GNI (current US$)
NY.GNP.MKTP.CD.value: GNI (formerly GNP) is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. Data are in current U.S. dollars.
